alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 9:30AM CST until February 03 at 12:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana... Bogue Chitto River Near Bush affecting St. Tammany Parish. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana...Mississippi... Pearl River Near Pearl River affecting Hancock, St. Tammany and Pearl River Counties. Pearl River Near Bogalusa affecting Washington and Pearl River Counties. For the Bogue Chitto River...including Bush...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Lower Pearl River...including Bogalusa, Pearl River...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bogue Chitto River near Bush. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Homes in low-lying areas on the downstream side of Louisiana Highway 21 near the bridge will flood. The access road upstream of the bridge will remain inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CST Monday the stage was 12.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.0 feet late tonight and linger above flood stage though much of the week. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.0 feet on 05/02/1991. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued this evening at 930 PM CST.
